communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Data from FPDS.gov indicates that DTRA has a contract with RELX, the parent company of LexisNexis (and other companies). It indicates that the contract is for "LexisNexis Diligence, Accurint and Virtual Identity Reports" subscriptions. Award ID: HDTRA122P0034

Please include: Any responsive documents relating to the overall agreement between DTRA and RELX that includes terms governing Accurint, LexisNexis Diligence, and Virtual Identity Report access and usage. Accurint includes any Accurint product including Risk, Public Safety Marketplace, etc.
If you subscribe to CourtLink or other RELX /Lexis services, you do not need to include those - this FOIA is for only Accurint, Diligence, and Virtual Identity Reports. 

I am seeking the following documents relating to Accurint, Diligence, and Virtual Identity Reports:
1) NDAs, MOUs, SOWs, MSAs, and any active contracting documents between your agency and LexisNexis/RELX
2) Any/all instructional and training materials or presentations relating to these services
3) DTRA use policies and standard operating procedures relating to use of these products
5) Marketing and promotional material, flyers, emails, or PDFs, relating to any of these products
4) Data sharing agreements with Accurint or other Accurint users (anything that would allow DTRA to provide data into Accurint that may be viewed by other agencies, or anything allowing DTRA to view data from other local, state, or federal agency users of Accurint)

Please provide material from January 1st, 2022 through the date of completion of this FOIA request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shawn A

title: Orders Issues per ADM John S. McCain Authorizing US Navy Court of Inquiry into USS Liberty Attack

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Orders Issues per ADM John S. McCain Authorizing US Navy Court of Inquiry into USS Liberty Attack
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the Israel Defense Force attacked our ship on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.[https://ussliberty.org]

CINCUSNAVEUR, ADM John S. McCain’s letter of June 10, 1967 (attached), authorizes the US Navy Court of Inquiry into the June 8, 1967, Israel Defense Force’s attack on the USS Liberty (AGTR-5).

Paragraph 7 of that authorization states, “Commander in Chief, U.S. Naval Forces Europe, will furnish the necessary reporters and other clerical assistance to the Court for the purpose of recording the proceedings and preparing the record of this Court of Inquiry.”

We are asking for a copy of all orders issued per this instruction to facilitate the movement of “the necessary reporters and other clerical assistance to the Court.”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors
